com.google.mu.safesql.SqlConsumer

Packages that use SqlConsumer
Package
Description
com.google.mu.safesql
A SQL template library with: Industry-strength library-enforced SQL injection safety - you cannot shoot yourself in the foot.

  • Uses of SqlConsumer in com.google.mu.safesql

    Methods in com.google.mu.safesql with parameters of type SqlConsumer
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    <T> List<T>
    SafeSql.query(Connection connection, SqlConsumer<? super Statement> settings, SqlFunction<? super ResultSet,? extends T> rowMapper)
    Similar to SafeSql.query(DataSource, SqlConsumer, SqlFunction), but uses an existing connection.
    <T> List<T>
    SafeSql.query(Connection connection, SqlConsumer<? super Statement> settings, Class<? extends T> resultType)
    Similar to SafeSql.query(DataSource, SqlConsumer, Class), but uses an existing connection.
    <T> List<T>
    SafeSql.query(DataSource dataSource, SqlConsumer<? super Statement> settings, SqlFunction<? super ResultSet,? extends T> rowMapper)
    Executes the encapsulated SQL as a query against dataSource.getConnection(), using settings (can be set via lambda like stmt -> stmt.setMaxRows(100)).
    <T> List<T>
    SafeSql.query(DataSource dataSource, SqlConsumer<? super Statement> settings, Class<? extends T> resultType)
    Similar to SafeSql.query(DataSource, Class), but with settings (can be set via lambda like stmt -> stmt.setMaxRows(100)) to allow customization.
    <T> Stream<T>
    SafeSql.queryLazily(Connection connection, SqlConsumer<? super Statement> settings, SqlFunction<? super ResultSet,? extends T> rowMapper)
    Executes the encapsulated SQL as a query against connection, with settings (can be set via lambda like stmt -> stmt.setFetchSize(100), and then fetches the results lazily in a stream.
    <T> Stream<T>
    SafeSql.queryLazily(Connection connection, SqlConsumer<? super Statement> settings, Class<? extends T> resultType)
    Executes the encapsulated SQL as a query against connection, with settings (can be set via lambda like stmt -> stmt.setFetchSize(100)), and then fetches the results lazily in a stream.
    int
    SafeSql.update(Connection connection, SqlConsumer<? super Statement> settings)
    Similar to SafeSql.update(Connection), but with settings (can be set via lambda like stmt -> stmt.setQueryTimeout(100)) to allow customization.
